definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: Fixed dead seaweed popping on, now stipples on.
sentences.chinese: 固定死的海藻出现，现在点画上。

sentences.english: Also with white flowers Stipple vines lining in the black for the CD.
sentences.chinese: 也是用白色花卉藤蔓点画在黑底为衬的CD上。

sentences.english: Our Stipple params create varying densities of noise to simulate that look.
sentences.chinese: 我们的画点画参数创造不同密度的噪音模拟的期待。

sentences.english: What stippling does is texture and darken the background.
sentences.chinese: 点画所做的是什么质地的背景变暗。

sentences.english: The virtual displacement method specifies that the sum of the shaded areas is equal to the sum of the stippled areas.
sentences.chinese: 虚位移法规定阴影面积之和等于点画面积之和。

sentences.english: Enforcement of such scholars take hold a brush, stippling sway, they dress.
sentences.chinese: 文人执之如搦毛笔，点画挥洒，气定神闲。

definition: against the bristles (brush movement in painting)
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
the tip of a writing brush/vigor of style in writing/stroke/touch
bristles lying down (brush movement in painting)
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting)
variant of 筆畫|笔画[bi3 hua4]
